document.docTitle: Hemimycale oxeata Huguenin & Salani & Lopes & Albano & Hajdu & Esteves 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Integrative taxonomy of Hemimycale (Hymedesmiidae: Poecilosclerida: Demospongiae) from Southeastern Brazil, with the description of two new species

Diagnosis. ThIS IS ThE ONLY SPEcIES IN ThE gENUS wITh OXEOTE LIkE TORNOTE mEgAScLERES IN AddITION TO ThE TYPIcAL (SUbTYLO-)STRONgYLES. MIcROScLERES AbSENT.

Etymology. ThE NAmE “
oxeata
” IS A REmINdER OF ThE PRESENcE OF OXEAS IN ThE NEw SPEcIES.

Description. ThINLY TO ThIckLY ENcRUSTINg ( 4.5‒8.7 cm wIdE, 0.8‒3.0 mm ThIck). ORANgE cOLOR IN LIFE , EXTERNALLY ANd INTERNALLY, ANd bEIgE AFTER FIXATION IN EThANOL. EcTOSOmE LIghTER cOLOREd ThAN ThE chOANOSOmE. OScULES cIRcULAR, wITh A PRONOUNcEd PERIOScULAR mEmbRANE ( 1.2‒3.7 mm wIdE). SUbdERmAL chANNELS cONSPIcUOUS ( 0.2‒0.7 mm wIdE), cONFLUENT TO OScULES. AREOLATEd PORE SIEVES cIRcULAR TO IRREgULAR, LARgE ( 1.6‒12 mm wIdE), wITh A SLIghTLY ELEVATEd RIm ( 1 mm hIgh), cONSPIcUOUS ANd cLOSELY SPAcEd ON ThE SURFAcE. SURFAcE EVEN , SmOOTh. CONSISTENcY SOFT , ELASTIc ANd FRIAbLE.

INTERNAL ANATOmY: EcTOSOmAL SkELETON UNdIFFERENTIATEd FROm ThE chOANOSOmE. AREOLATEd PORE SIEVES STRENgThENEd bY EVENLY SPAcEd (79‒170 µm), PERPENdIcULARLY ARRANgEd, dENSE chOANOSOmAL mULTISPIcULAR TRAcTS OF (SUbTYLO-)STRONgYLES, SPLITTINg OUT IN FAN ShAPEd TUFTS SUPPORTINg ThE AREOLAE wALL. CRIbRIPORAL mEmbRANE 11 ‒ 12 µm ThIck. SUbEcTOSOmAL LAcUNAE EVIdENT (78 ‒ 291 µm wIdE). ChOANOSOmAL SkELETON PLUmOSE, cOmPOSEd bY SINUOUS, AScENdINg, mULTISPIcULAR TRAcTS OF STRONgYLES ANd OXEAS (11‒18 SPIcULES wIdE, UP TO 58 µm ThIck) ENdINg IN SUbEcTOSOmAL TUFTS OF STRONgYLES, SOmETImES wITh POINTS PROjEcTEd bEYONd ThE EcTOSOmE ON ThE SURFAcE. ISOLATEd STRONgYLES ANd OXEAS ALSO cOmmONLY FOUNd ScATTEREd IN ThE INNER PARTS OF ThE chOANOSOmE.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ecology.
Hemimycale oxeata
sp. nov.
OccURS IN ShALLOw wATERS (dOwN TO 19 m dEEP), ENcRUSTINg VERTIcAL ROckY wALLS, EXPOSEd TO hIgh SPEEd cURRENTS, OR IN ScIOPhILOUS hAbITATS. COLLEcTEd SPEcImENS wERE OVERgROwINg ROdOLIThS, mUSSELS, bARNAcLES ANd AzOOXANThELATE hARd cORALS. POLYchAETE wORmS cAN bE ASSOcIATEd wITh ThE NEw SPEcIES.

Distribution. ( FIg. 1 ) SOUThEASTERN BRAzIL EcOREgION:
RIO dE JANEIRO
(MURIcY et al. , 1991 AS
Hemimycale SP.
),
SãO PAULO
ANd
SANTA CATARINA
STATES ( FIRST REcORd IN ThE PRESENT STUdY).

Remarks.
Hemimycale oxeata
sp. nov.
IS ThE ONLY SPEcIES IN ThE gENUS wITh OXEAS IN AddITION TO (SUbTYLO-)STRONgYLES AS mEgAScLERES. ThE OXEAS EXhIbITEd bY ThE NEw SPEcIES ARE AcTUALLY OXEOTE-LIkE TORNOTES, PRObAbLY dERIVEd FROm STRONgYLES, wITh TELEScOPEd OR mUcRONATE ENdS, ANd A STRAIghT AXIS .

Hemimycale oxeata
sp. nov.
IS SImILAR TO
H. columella
ANd
H. insularis
. ThEY ShARE A SALmON ORANgE cOLOR IN LIFE, A ThINLY ENcRUSTINg gROwTh FORm, ANd IRREgULARLY OUTLINEd, SLIghTLY RAISEd PORE SIEVES. ThIS IS PARTIcULARLY SO wITh ThE LATTER SPEcIES (FIg PAgES 138‒139; MORAES, 2011). HOwEVER, IN AddITION TO ThE PRESENcE OF EXcLUSIVE OXEAS,
H. oxeata
sp. nov.
hAS SmALLER (SUbTYLO-)STRONgYLES ThAN ThOSE ObSERVEd IN
H. columella
ANd
H. insularis
( TAbLE 3 ), ANd STYLES ARE ENTIRELY AbSENT (PRESENT IN
H. columella
; BOwERbANk, 1874 AS
Desmacidon columella
; VAcELET et al. , 1987; VAN SOEST, 2002A; URIz et al. , 2017).

AddITIONAL SPEcIES IN
Hemimycale
ARE ALSO cLEARLY dIFFERENT FROm ThE NEw SPEcIES.
Hemimycale arabica
IS dARk gREENISh-bLUE whEN ALIVE , hAS ShORTER ANd ThINNER STRONgYLES ( TAbLE 3 ), ANd SImILARLY TO
H. columella
mAY hAVE STYLES IN AddITION TO STRONgYLES AS mEgAScLERES ( ILAN et al. , 2004), whIch ARE cOmPLETELY AbSENT IN ThE NEw SPEcIES.
Hemimycale rhodus
cAN bE dIFFERENTIATEd FROm
H. oxeata
sp. nov.
bY ITS LONgER (SUbTYLO-)STRONgYLES ( TAbLE 3 ).
Hemimycale mediterranea
hAS A bROwNISh cOLOR dUE TO ITS ASSOcIATION wITh cYANObAcTERIA (URIz et al. , 2017), ANd hIghER ANd NARROwER PORE SIEVES ( 1.5‒2 mm hIgh; 3 mm wIdE). IN AddITION, ThEIR STRONgYLES SEEm TO POSSESS mORE REgULAR ENdINgS ( FIg. 4A‒E ; URIz et al. , 2017) ThAN ThOSE OF ThE NEw SPEcIES, whIch FREqUENTLY VARY TO SUbTYLOTES OR SUbTYLOSTRONgYLES ( FIg. 3E‒F ).

HENcE,
H. oxeata
sp. nov.
cAN bE cLEARLY SET APART FROm OThER SPEcIES IN ThE gENUS bY ITS SALmON ORANgE cOLOR IN LIFE , ANd OXEOTE-LIkE TORNOTES IN AddITION TO ThE TYPIcAL (SUbTYLO-)STRONgYLES OFTEN SEEN IN ThE gENUS. SPEcImENS IdENTIFIEd bY MURIcY et al. (1991) AS
Hemimycale SP.
FROm ARRAIAL dO CAbO (
RIO dE JANEIRO
STATE ) bELONg TO ThIS NEw SPEcIES.
